item.description: The early history of the Franco-Americans of Manchester finds many connections in St. Augustin Cemetery, the oldest Franco-American cemetery in the city. This tour, led by local historians Richard Duckoff and John Jordan, will include the stories of important early leaders in the French-Canadian immigrant community. Meet at the chapel in the center of the cemetery, which is located on lower South Beech Street just opposite Alpheus Street. The tour lasts from 1:30 p.m.-3:30 p.m. Pre-registration is required. Please wear comfortable walking shoes. MHA MEMBERS: $5.00 - GENERAL PUBLIC: $10.00.
item.name: The Old St. Augustin Cemetery - Walking Tour
